skill.name: pyhealth
skill.description: Comprehensive healthcare AI toolkit for developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models with clinical data. This skill should be used when working with electronic health records (EHR), clinical prediction tasks (mortality, readmission, drug recommendation), medical coding systems (ICD, NDC, ATC), physiological signals (EEG, ECG), healthcare datasets (MIMIC-III/IV, eICU, OMOP), or implementing deep learning models for healthcare applications (RETAIN, SafeDrug, Transformer, GNN).
skill.summary: Comprehensive healthcare AI toolkit for developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models w...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Scanned documentation files only with no executable code. No network calls, data access, or suspicious instructions detected. No indicators of data theft or malicious execution.

content.user_title: Build healthcare AI pipelines with PyHealth
content.value_statement: Healthcare data workflows are complex and slow to standardize. This skill guides dataset loading, task setup, model choice, and evaluation with PyHealth.
actual_capabilities: Explain how to load MIMIC, eICU, and OMOP datasets using PyHealth interfaces
List predefined clinical tasks like mortality, readmission, and drug recommendation
Recommend model families such as RETAIN, SafeDrug, Transformer, and GNN
Outline preprocessing workflows for EHR, signals, text, and images
Describe training, evaluation, calibration, and fairness metrics
limitations: Does not provide datasets or download data
Does not execute training or access GPUs
Requires PyHealth installed in the user environment
Clinical validation and compliance remain the user responsibility

use_cases.title: ICU mortality modeling plan
use_cases.description: Set up MIMIC-IV loading, mortality task definition, RETAIN model choice, and evaluation metrics for an ICU study.

use_cases.title: Medication recommendation setup
use_cases.description: Configure SafeDrug with medication coding preprocessing and multi-label metrics for safer prescription support.

use_cases.title: EEG sleep staging workflow
use_cases.description: Outline dataset selection, signal preprocessing, CNN or RNN models, and per-stage evaluation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Getting started
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the PyHealth workflow for loading a dataset, setting a task, choosing a model, and evaluating results.

prompt_templates.title: EHR prediction task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a step by step plan for mortality prediction on MIMIC-IV using PyHealth, including split strategy and metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Medical coding help
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe how to translate ICD-9 to ICD-10 and group codes into clinical categories with PyHealth tools.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: List calibration and fairness checks to add after training a clinical model and explain when to use each.

output_examples.input: Provide a plan to build a readmission model with PyHealth on eICU data.
output: Load eICU with the PyHealth dataset class and review dataset statistics
Apply the readmission task function and split by patient to prevent leakage
Choose a Transformer or RETAIN model based on interpretability needs
Train with AUPRC monitoring and evaluate with AUROC, AUPRC, and calibration

best_practices: Split by patient to prevent leakage across train and test
Match metrics to task type and class imbalance
Assess fairness and calibration before deployment
anti_patterns: Using visit level splits that leak patient history
Ignoring missing data and coding errors in preprocessing
Reporting only accuracy for imbalanced outcomes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance text and workflows usable in those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not run code, download datasets, or provide clinical validation.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my PyHealth project?
faq.answer: Yes, it aligns with PyHealth classes for datasets, tasks, models, and training.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides guidance and does not access files or networks.

faq.question: What should I do if results look poor?
faq.answer: Review preprocessing, class imbalance, metric choice, and split strategy.

faq.question: How does it compare to general ML assistants?
faq.answer: It focuses on healthcare datasets, tasks, and models specific to PyHealth.
